settings.name: Siegfried Sorkpor
settings.title: SMART INSURANCE PRODUCT MANAGER & Machine Learning Specialist
settings.summary: Experienced Product Manager and Machine Learning Specialist driving innovation and delivering data-driven solutions in insurance and fintech.

items.description: Led successful development of innovative smart insurance application achieving 90% target completion. Conducted extensive market analysis driving innovation and differentiation. Created comprehensive agile product roadmap delivering features on time and budget. Built strong relationships with external partners ensuring compliance and risk mitigation.

Improved driver safety, reduced monthly vehicle maintenance costs by 20%, and decreased idle time of vehicles by 30% through engineering a machine learning automated fleet analytics system. Personalized insurance plans for fleet drivers resulting in a 20% reduction in monthly insurance premiums. Reduced company fleet accidents by more than 40% with a machine learning system to identify high-risk drivers. Increased conversions significantly by working with product and marketing teams. Performed impact analyses and analyzed the system for new enhancements/functionalities, implementing ETL changes.

Spearheaded the implementation of cohort analysis that resulted in a 10% sales boost and significant revenue increase. Applied customer segmentation techniques to reduce customer churn by 5%. Provided business insights to client organizations by translating business problems into solvable cases. Led multiple data teams in the design, collection and cleaning of primary and secondary data to enable quality data-driven decision-making.

Planned and implemented students' and faculty members' research activity calendar. Supported students facing difficulties in dissertation projects. Served as secretary to dissertation Viva panel and assistant to the dean of faculty. Provided support for the establishment of new units: a business incubator, and the Centre for Sustainability, Development, and Agribusiness (CENSDA).

Coordinated participant contact-making targeted phone calls to gather key conference participant information. Ensured accurate inputting into key data systems, following data compliance legislation. Spotted data errors and worked with managers to correct reporting information. Recognized for suggesting areas for improving data handling, leading to policy change.

items.title: Diabetes Prediction
items.description: Applied six machine learning algorithms (Logistic Regression, Decision tree, K-Nearest Neighbour, Support Vector Machine, Random Forest, and Naive Bayes) to ascertain if a person would have diabetes based on provided features.

items.title: Heart Stroke Prediction
items.description: Applied a set of machine learning algorithms to predict heart stroke based on medical data.

items.title: Cohort Analysis and Modelling in Online Retail
items.description: Performed a cohort analysis of online retail using data from Kaggle to study customer behavior and identify trends or patterns.

items.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (Employee Attrition)
items.description: Examined a dataset to explore and ascertain the various relationships that exist between factors influencing employee attrition.

items.title: Predicting Tesla Stock Price
items.description: Developed and evaluated the performance and predictive power of a model trained and tested on the Tesla Stock Price Dataset.

items.title: Cohort Analysis and Modeling in Online Retail (Housing Price Prediction)
items.description: Developed and evaluated the performance and predictive power of a model trained and tested on data collected from houses in Boston's suburbs to predict monetary value.

items.degree: Master of Science - MS, Data Science
